com.delta.swiftq.actions

Class AdminAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
      • com.delta.swiftq.actions.ActionSupportWithSession
        • com.delta.swiftq.actions.AdminAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

extends ActionSupportWithSession
implements org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ServletRequestAware, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ApplicationAware

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String Delete()
      This method gets the values from display.jsp that have been selected for deletion and passes them into the DeleteUsers method in ConnectionManager.This method will then carry out the required processes to delete the user(s).
      java.lang.String Display()
      Calls the DisplayUsers method within ConnectionManager to retrieve the users from the database and sets the user object to "disp" so display.jsp can access the data.
      java.lang.String Edit()
      Retrieves the selectedID from the display.jsp file and calls methods held within connection manager to get the userDetails required to populate the fields in the edituser.jsp page.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdminAction

        public AdminAction()

    • Method Detail

      • Display

        public java.lang.String Display()
        Calls the DisplayUsers method within ConnectionManager to retrieve the users from the database and sets the user object to "disp" so display.jsp can access the data.
        Returns:
        SUCCESS if an admin user is trying to access the page, otherwise return "permission_error".

      • Delete

        public java.lang.String Delete()
        This method gets the values from display.jsp that have been selected for deletion and passes them into the DeleteUsers method in ConnectionManager.This method will then carry out the required processes to delete the user(s). If no users have been selected for deletion the function will return an error
        Returns:
        ERROR if no user has been selected for deletion. SUCCESS if a user has been selected. "permission_error" if the user trying to access the method is not an admin.

      • Edit

        public java.lang.String Edit()
        Retrieves the selectedID from the display.jsp file and calls methods held within connection manager to get the userDetails required to populate the fields in the edituser.jsp page.
        Returns:
        SUCCESS if the UserID selected exists. ERROR if it does not. "permission_error" if the user trying to access the method is not an admin.

      • UpdateUserDetails

        public java.lang.String UpdateUserDetails()
        This calls a method within ConnectionManager that updates the database with the changes that have been made by the user.
        Returns:
        SUCCESS if an admin user is trying to access the page, otherwise return "permission_error".

      • Insert

        public java.lang.String Insert()
        When the user selects to insert a new user this method returns SUCCESS which is used to redirect the user to the page used to create a new user.
        Returns:
        SUCCESS if an admin user is trying to access the page, otherwise return "permission_error".

      • InsertDisplay

        public java.lang.String InsertDisplay()
        Displays admin version of the registration page. This page allows the admin to specify the user type.
        Returns:

      • InsertUser

        public java.lang.String InsertUser()
                            throws ConnectionManagerException
        Throws:
        ConnectionManagerException
